body_html:
@meteorcloudy @asimshankar to include in the discussion.
But the ".so" file extensions are the shared object extensions for linux.
Unless bazel intelligently replaces the "so" with "dll", your OS would be confused trying to load the resulting "so" file.

If bazel does this intelligently, still our build target should not have the "so" extension.
It should just be libtensorflow, and on macos the result will be a dylib, on windows it will be a dll, on linux it will be a so.

body:
@meteorcloudy @asimshankar to include in the discussion.
But the ".so" file extensions are the shared object extensions for linux.
Unless bazel intelligently replaces the "so" with "dll", your OS would be confused trying to load the resulting "so" file.

If bazel does this intelligently, still our build target should not have the "so" extension.
It should just be libtensorflow, and on macos the result will be a dylib, on windows it will be a dll, on linux it will be a so.
